para.text: project are listed below. The next topic,
, describes ten additional fields that are displayed in gray and can't be directly edited.

The fields are listed in the order they currently appear in WallsMap, either as a form on the right side of the Selected Points window or as columns in an initially-opened table view (the table can be rearranged). The
is what's displayed when the mouse pointer hovers over the field's name in the Selected Points window. (See top image in
are important items of information that may not be obvious.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave or feature's name (should be unique within county)

Used for map labeling, and is one of two default fields for text searches. If the first character is an asterisk (*) then this record will be deleted from the master database when an update shapefile is processed. Our convention for records that locate one of several entrances to a cave system is to enter the system and entrance names separated by a comma. Example: "Longhorn Caverns, Sam Bass Entrance"

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: One of two default fields for text searches

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Filled automatically when a record is added (or relocated)

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: : A humanly passable subsurface cavity at least 5 meters in traverse length, where no dimension of the entrance exceeds the length.
: A closed depression or vertically oriented opening. Its dimensions are at least human-sized, but its subsurface extent does not fit the definition of a cave.
: A karst cavity that does not fit the definition of a cave, sink, spring, or shelter.

: A humanly enterable horizontal recess in a cliff face created by an overhang. Either the height from floor level of the overhang or its horizontal extent along the cliff face is larger than the maximum distance from its front edge to the back wall.
: A naturally occurring cavity or area from which water emerges.
: Geological or anthropomorphic features of significance that do not fit any of the above categories.
For brevity, "naturally occurring" was removed from the first three definitions. Also see the Notes section under

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: If type is "Other" or a special case, enter a descriptive term: Fossil spring, Well, Mine, Railroad tunnel, etc.
Can also be used to further characterize a cave, cavity, sink, etc.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave's surveyed length in meters. H or T can be appended to indicate a Horizontal or Traverse length as opposed to an unspecified type. Commas can separate multiple length types. Example: 5.5H, 10T
Corresponds to three numeric fields in TSS2000.MDB. A number without a T or H suffix specifies the "Survlen-Unspecified" field value in the MDB record. Leave blank if feature is unsurveyed.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave's explored length in meters. As with surveyed lengths, H or T can be appended to specify a Horizontal or Traverse explored length type.

Corresponds to three numeric fields in TSS2000.MDB. A number without a T or H suffix specifies the "Explen-Unspecified" field value in the MDB record. Can be left blank to indicate that the explored length is the same as the surveyed length.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave's surveyed vertical extent in meters
Leave blank if feature is unsurveyed.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave's explored vertical extent in meters
Can be left blank to indicate that the explored depth is the same as the surveyed depth.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Elevation in feet of the main or datum entrance
This field will be initialized automatically if an elevation model NTI layer covers the new (or relocated) feature's location.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Filled automatically when a record is added (or relocated)

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Concise description of the cave or feature
Normally no more than one line of text

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Detailed report, optionally including author, description, history, biology, geology, archaeology, paleontology, meteorology, conservation, and bibliography.
Format varies, but can be a long report in rich text format, can paste from Word, etc.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Links to scanned map images in folder ..\TSS Maps. (CTRL-left-click button to open editor instead of viewer.)
memo storing specially-formatted links to image files
To add maps to an empty field, click the field's button to open the editor, then click "Image Mode" and follow instructions. By convention, map images are stored in folder
, which is at the same level as the shapefile's folder,

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Links to photographic images in folder ..\TSS Photos. (CTRL-left-click button to open editor instead of viewer.)
memo storing specially-formatted links to image files
Add links to photos the same way as described for the MAPS field. The image files should reside in folder
, which is at the same level as the shapefile's folder,

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: This field is not intended to be manually edited. From time to time it will be automatically filled by a program (

) that processes James's TexBio files. Note that a species name is sometimes prefixed with one of these characters: $ - type locality, * - sight record, ? - very small specimen possibly representing an undescribed species

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Persons or references with information on this feature
Normally this is the person who submitted the information for inclusion in the database.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Can be a narrative description or a distance and direction to the nearest landmark.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Probably should also include an "as-of" date.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Additional information not normally part of comments. (Management info, survey data, news articles, etc.)
Note that memo fields can have active internet links as well as links to local documents, such as PDFs (maps or reports). You can enter these links via the text editor's right-click context menu:
Insert | Link to local data file...

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Source of coordinates (name and/or method: USGS topo, DOQ, Google Earth, GPS, etc.)

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Estimated horizontal position error in meters, such as EPE from GPS

Can be as large as 5000 meters if the area contains few caves and such an approximate location would be helpful. (A maximum hasn't been decided on.) A good GPS location will typically have an expected error of 3-5 meters.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: One of the following rock categories (or a description) --
: gypsum, gypsite, selenite, or a similar rock
: granite boulders or talus, syenite, etc.
: soil, silt, sand, caliche, clay, or similar material
: lava, rhyolite, tuff, volcanic breccia, or similar material
Although the above 5 choices appear in a drop-down list box, with "Carbonate" being the default for new records, we can enter any text in this field.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Exploration status: Complete, Open passage, Dig, Blast, Sump, Dome climb, etc.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: TSS area (could be a ranch, hill, creek, or subdivision)

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Needs management, ecological or hydrogeological study, information for (or from) USFWS, BCCP, etc.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Who to contact in case of a data request

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Geologic formation, group, age, and other details.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Open, filled, gated, covered, closed, sensitive or proprietary controls on cave data, etc.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Proprietary conservation status information from Texas Nature Conservancy
Conservation easement information for this location provided by TNC. This field is filled automatically when updates are processed and shouldn't be manually edited.

table.style: width:800px; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Cave is rumored or information is sketchy

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave is an endangered species locality

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave is geologically or mineralogically significant

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;
width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave is part of a managed preserve or park (show caves not included)

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Cave is proprietary, information cannot be given out without permission from the contact

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Existence of a sketch map isn't sufficient.

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: Is there a map of the cave?

table.style: width:800px; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:#d2d2d2;

para.text: This list continues with a set of 10 fields whose values are automatically maintained. (See
